website_summaries.verdict: Classically styled executive chair with attractive aluminum accents offers sophisticated looks without a high price tag.
pros: Well-padded seat, arms, and back provide excellent comfort and decent support to the lumbar region
Pneumatic control for easy height adjustment
Also has tilt-tension to control stiffness when you lean back
cons: Inconsistent quality control means some mechanisms squeak annoyingly
PVC wears more quickly than real leather, leading to worn patches
Fixed arms and back reduce ergonomic adjustability

customer_reviews.title: What a mess
customer_reviews.text: 1. Bonded leather didn't last a year, the handles are peeling off as I sit in this chair. 2. Squeaks like crazy, have to reapply some wd-40 every now and then. 3. Foam cushion inserts are so-so. 4. The button inserts and black plastic cover covering the screws on the side comes off periodically. TLDR; get something that doesn't have 'bonded leather' as the material, that and maybe something a bit more reputable.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: I guess it is what a 100 dollar chair amounts to these days. Disappointing. The bottom seat part broke where the arms attach to the back and there is no structure to the chair, you cannot lean back without it breaking even more. I reordered another chair in the hopes that it will not be as defective as the first but that was my only chance given the packaging was ruined during shipping and I will be reusing the second chairs box to return the first. I guess I will have the opportunity to do the same thang till I win the chair lottery. Wish me luck. Give this chair a HARD pass unless you are feeling lucky.
customer_reviews.author: XxLocalMaterialxX

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Material - AmazonBasics High-Back Executive Chair - Black
customer_reviews.text: The chair is very sturdy, but the issue is the cheap material used. From the pictures, you can see how the material has started to peel off. I purchased it March 2017. You get what you pay for because a good executive chair cost hundreds of dollars and not $110. Next time, I will buy a real leather chair because now I have to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: TM

customer_reviews.title: Big mistake
customer_reviews.text: Everything of this chair is already falling apart My wife bought this for me in April. It's been making sounds like I had it 25 years.
customer_reviews.author: jermaine

customer_reviews.title: Superb Comfort = Increased Productivity
customer_reviews.text: For starters, installation took about 10 minutes without bumping into any problems. And, so far, I've had this chair for 4 months now and there is nothing bad to say about it. I am 6' 1" and 195 lb and I work at home and spend about 8 to 10 hours daily sitting on this chair. So far, it has provided continuous comfort for my back and my productivity has increased since switching to this chair. Update: After 8 months of daily use, the cushioning still feels like new!
customer_reviews.author: TY16

customer_reviews.title: Got a used chair
customer_reviews.text: The chair looks good enough once assembled but I received a used product. Scratches on the legs and several other places on the chair.
customer_reviews.author: Andy B.

customer_reviews.title: amazon needs to follow their own directions
customer_reviews.text: terrible product to assemble . i will avoid amazon products that require assembly - you obliviously don't test your products.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Mcquillan

customer_reviews.title: Broke After 3 Months
customer_reviews.text: It now reclines super far back because it broke, after 3 months. I hardly used it to begin with. Maybe 30 hours total.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Not an all day chair.
customer_reviews.text: After 6 months of use , I'm off to staples to get a better chair. The chair is self is fine for limited use, but not comfortable for typical work day chair.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Not made for tall people.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chair based on the reviews. This chair is not made for tall people. The arm rests are low and there's no way to adjust them. They're pretty much useless for me. I'm 5'10".
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: SMALL
customer_reviews.text: This chair is ridiculously small. I am 5' 3" `180 lbs. I've had kids so I do have hips but they aren't so wide I don't fit in any other normal sized chair. This office chair though? Nope, the chair is so narrow, I bump into the arm rests every few seconds. Also the arm rests and the head rest lay very, very low. I am currently sitting in the chair after setting it up earlier today. I can honestly say I hate it. Can't wait until tomorrow when this thing gets broken down, returned, and I get a regular sized chair!
customer_reviews.author: StephanieTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Have had this chair about a month and the cheap material is already ripping apart.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Received damaged
customer_reviews.text: When I received this package I noticed some black smudged spots which stands out more on a white chair along with what looks like a scratch peeling off the pain on the arm rest area.
customer_reviews.author: avraham berkowitz

customer_reviews.title: piece of garbage, lopsided
customer_reviews.text: never level, lopsided and if the chair goes up you can not get it to lower, most amazon purchaces are great but this is gaarbage
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wooden seat base
customer_reviews.text: Metal screws in a wooden seat base so, the wood didn't hold out very long. It lasted a little over a year.
customer_reviews.author: Bakersdirtydozen

customer_reviews.title: Cheap! Don't Buy!
customer_reviews.text: It always felt flimsy and poorly made. After a year and a half of moderate use, the screws that hold the bracket inside the back of the chair that the arm attaches to fell out. When I leaned back in the chair it ripped apart. It isn't very comfortable after you use it a few times. This chair is overpriced for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: 225 Maximum load weight.
customer_reviews.text: Chair is very nice and comfortable for the price point, however the bullet points for the product's page show maximum weight limit at 250 lbs. I've submitted a change request. In the instruction manual, the specifications section show it at 225 lbs. I chose this chair because of the extra 25 lbs weight capacity compared to similarly priced models.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel McCracken

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Terrible Chair - Broke Within a Few months
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely HATE this chair. Just because it's AmazonBasics does not mean a thing. It is so incredibly cheaply made. After using it for just 5 months the back part broke and it's sitting at a 75 degree angle thereby making it extremely uncomfortable and actually painful for my neck. So disappointed. You can go to Staples down the block and get a real brand name chair for the same exact price. Just because it looks nice and comfortable doesn't mean a thing either. Do some research and get a good hair
customer_reviews.author: Richie Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Not intended for daily use.
customer_reviews.text: After six months of using this chair daily, I can state it's not appropriate for daily use. I work from home and already broke the back of the chair. In addition seat cushion is beginning to bunch. Chair is appropriate for light use, but definitely not a daily work chair.
customer_reviews.author: DiagonalBike

customer_reviews.title: Please look elsewhere, the worst chair I have ever purchased.
customer_reviews.text: After at least a month of use the black plastic used to cover the chair falls off in chunks revealing a very ugly and thin padding material. The padding is very thin and not comfortable to sit on or lean back after several hours. The hard plastic legs and arms start to degrade and crack and a wheel has already fallen off. This is not a good chair for office/frequent use at a computer.
customer_reviews.author: Orpheus

customer_reviews.title: Oh.... my.......
customer_reviews.text: Wow!!! I see why this chair got so many 5 star reviews! It's worth every penny. I work at a public high school so there's not a ton if money for new furniture; all the chairs have to be 15+ years old, so I decided to buy my own chair. I know it's probably not a priority to people but if you're at a desk 7+ hours a day, do yourself a favor. This was one of the best purchases I've made. Amazing quality, easy installation, so comfortable. I looooove it!
customer_reviews.author: TrishTop Contributor: Nail Polish

customer_reviews.title: AmazonBasics High Back Executive Chair - Black REVIEW
customer_reviews.text: Great chair! Amazon.com AmazonBasics High-Back Executive Black Chair review 10 min assembly. Comfortable executive chair upholstered in bonded black leather and PVC Padded seat and back for all-day comfort and support Pneumatic seat-height adjustment 360-degree swivel smooth-rolling casters Measures 29.13 by 25.59 by 41.34 to 45.08 inches (LxWxH) 1-year limited warranty. Assembly instructions included. Maximum weight capacity - 250 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Terrible chair, it is not Bonded black leather and ...
customer_reviews.text: Terrible chair, it is not Bonded black leather and if it is, then it is extremely cheap, it is already shredding on the seat, the seat cushion is completely flattened it feels like you're sitting on a park bench, and it put's your rear end to sleep. Extremely uncomfortable, To top it off this review is written March 18th 2018, And I purchased this July 2nd 2017... THIS IS NOT EVEN A YEAR OLD.. :-/ 0/10 Satisfied after about 7months. This has to be this biggest bogus by I have made in the last decade.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Basics, Piece a junk, but replacement approval is the only reason for 2 additional stars
customer_reviews.text: Seemed fine until I decided to lean back and the whole backrest gave out! That said, the chair is only 4 months old and after excruciating conversations Amazon is sending a replacement and requiring me to return the the damaged chair. I hope I can dismantle the it in order to fit in the replacement chair's box!! Way too much work and with all we spend with Amazon, you's think they would allow pictures and avoid the expense of a returned item that is going to go in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable, horrible back positioning.
customer_reviews.text: I'll be returning this or asking for a refund. Two big issues here. If you're on the short side (I'm 5'5"), the over bolstered front edge of the seat will cut off your circulation and make the back part of your knees hurt that rest on it. The tilt only goes backwards for the overall seat positioning, which would be fine, if the seat's starting position wasn't reclining already. Can't position the back to sit up straight, or only be slightly reclined. Do not buy for a desk chair if you are going to need to sit up and work on a computer/laptop on it. You'll regret it like I do.
customer_reviews.author: Hollie Turner

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I received this on Mar 21 and assembled it the next day (I'm a home office worker, so I've done a LOT of these chair assemblies over the years). Typically, I expect a chair like this to last at least 1-2 years (18 months is normal for my usage). After 6 weeks of use, the lower-front bolt attaching the right arm to the chair base has broken through the chair's base material. For reference, I weigh 235lbs, and I'm not generally using my office chair like a recliner. Comfort and style were fine, but based on the poor durability of this one, I must give it a 1 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: K. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable, and after a month it squeaks more than my last chair (that I had for several years)
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed, considering the positive reviews written. I am not a tall person, and the seat is much too short/not deep enough. This means the back of my legs don't hit properly and they actually fall asleep after sitting for a while. Also, even after tightening up the fasteners (after only a month) it squeaks horribly when I shift around in the seat. This is THE reason I ditched my other chair........too distracting on calls. Overall, not a comfortable sit. Not happy at all and probably will end up going to a brick and mortar store as I've usually done in the past.
customer_reviews.author: S. Springer

customer_reviews.title: Its great as long as you dont need to sit in it.
customer_reviews.text: After assembling which was super easy, only 12 bolts allen head with supplied allen wrench, it only took about 15 minutes from opening the box to sitting in a completely assembled chair. The chair looks great and the the leather itself has a nice feel to it. Sadly I found the chair to be very uncomfortable to sit in, the back is too reclined to sit up straight and the seat cushion under your legs is overstuffed and makes my legs fall asleep. Even with the seat tilted all the way forward it is not enough to get comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Still great after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: We have had this chair for almost 2 years, use it daily and it looks like the day we bought it. I am not sure how other people treat theirs that it looks so bad after a few months, but no way will it fall apart like some of the photos unless you are contantly scraping the arms against something. Great chair, super comfortable. I only paid a little over $100 but with everyone working from home guess it is supply and demand as far as the increase is concerned.
customer_reviews.author: SEJ

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart after normal use for 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chair 2 months ago, it is now physically falling apart after normal use. The armrests are really what holds it together, and what they anchor into is not sufficient. When leaning back recently I heard and felt a couple pops as those screws broke out of whatever they were in. Now it feels like it will be days before it completely breaks apart.
customer_reviews.author: An Outlaw

customer_reviews.title: I'm in it off and on over 12 hours a day and it is very comfortable. The only issue I've had is that when ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this chair for a little over a year now. I'm in it off and on over 12 hours a day and it is very comfortable. The only issue I've had is that when I rock, it squeaks. A little WD40 every 2 weeks and all is good. Update: Almost 2 years now and it is just as comfortable as when I bought it. It is still just as sturdy, nothing broken, even all the plastic screw covers are all there.It even looks great still. I would definately recommend this chair Worth every penny I paid for it....
customer_reviews.author: Donald T.

customer_reviews.title: An excellent, if pricey, scratching post
customer_reviews.text: Within minutes of assembling this, my cats were already acquainting their claws with it. A couple months in and I can confirm that their initial attraction wasn't simply over its novelty as a new item - it is still their preferred scratching post despite many more affordable scratching posts being offered around the house. They also enjoy both the main seat and the top of the back as cat beds, more so than the cat tree in the house, so another win, and its cheaper than the cat trees at pet smart. Also, its an ok chair. Reasonably easy to assemble, and comfortable enough for the price. When there isn't a cat on it
customer_reviews.author: JBW

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, sturdy and quite a step up from the basic chairs
customer_reviews.text: Just received my chair. Very easy to put together, took 20 minutes maybe. Been sitting in it for 2 days and it is wonderful. I had a Walmart special, that was a nightmare from leaning back to the up-down never working right. This (so far - knock on wood) has been perfect. Would highly recommend it for this price point. There is another one I almost bought at an Office store for 189 that was and could be exactly the same. Its a no brainer really. Here is a pic of the chair in my home office. The office is under construction right now as the house gets worked on... so pardon the mess LOL.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Zuch

customer_reviews.title: Great chair for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this chair for my husband for Christmas and it has exceeded expectations! I read all the reviews and was concerned about squeaking, fabric wear and durability, but after 6 months, we have thankfully not experienced any of the issues others have had. I was actually shocked at just how comfortable and ergonomically designed this chair is! My husband is 190 lbs. and sits in that chair an average of 9 hours a day, 5 days a week + 3-4 hours on weekends and he loves it. I would highly recommend if you are looking for a very good, reasonably priced office chair.
customer_reviews.author: LCM

customer_reviews.title: Great at first
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chair in March when I transitioned to working from home full time and my old office chair was no longer up to snuff for 8 hours of sitting. It was really easy to put together and initially was super comfortable. It's now the end of August and this chair is barely comfortable. After even an hour of sitting my back starts to hurt, and the padding for my rear just is not as good as it was a few months ago. To say I'm disappointed is an understatement.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal G

customer_reviews.title: Chair is holding up well
customer_reviews.text: I almost didn't buy this chair because of the reviews (and pictures) stating it fell apart. I'm 6' tall 185 pounds and this chair looks as good as it did the day I got it (6 months ago). I'm a student and spend multiple hours a day in this chair reading assignments and typing up papers and it's holding up like a champ. I don't know what everyone else is doing with these chairs, but don't believe everything you read. When this one dies I'll definitely purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: junk to be replaced every two years
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd chair, neither lasted very long basically that faux leather started cracking up all over the place after a year or so of 8hr/d use. The last one was a doozy bought 2018, the internal structure started falling apart after two years. Haven't looked inside to see what kind of junk material is the frame made off. I'm 190 lad, not a featherweight but nothing American heavy. For the last one paid $110 - $30 day dea, which was a fair privel. Now they want $140 with no deal in sight.
customer_reviews.author: otempores

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I agonize over choosing a decent chair online. I've gone through so many, and none can seem to stand up to regular use. This is the exception. I bought this chair in Dec of '16. It's now Oct of '17, and it's still like brand new. Very comfortable, too. And sturdy - I've had the arms snap on so many cheap office chairs when I recline for any length of time. I weigh 240 lbs, which is hefty, but not obese. I should be able to lean back in a chair without worrying. So far...this one's a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: A good office chair but
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice chair, I bought a brown color one, it looks nice and is comfortable for sitting at the desk and working. However, I noticed that some of the nut/screw cover on the art rests have started falling out after use of chair for about a month and a half. There were no extra nut covers in the packet, so now I have holes, don't look nice for a new office. I would prefer if seller can provide some extra nut covers. Otherwise, it si a good chair.
customer_reviews.author: Sattie

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: Great chair. Comfortable. I love it. One caution. This requires assembly. The first steps are very straightforward and easy. The part where you assemble the chair back was very difficult for me. I suggest having help to hold things in place while you try to get the screws started. That step took me all day, but I finally made it by attaching the arms to the chair back first, and then attach the arms to the seat. That worked better for me.
customer_reviews.author: Old guy

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, simple office chair.
customer_reviews.text: These aren't the most comfortable office chairs, but for the price, the quality and build seem right on point. There is little to no lumbar support, and the cushioning is pretty stiff. The leatherette seems fine, but will probably show wear pretty soon. These chairs are great if you are looking for something cheap, basic, and reliable. This isn't for you if you are looking for your everyday 9-5 desk chair.
customer_reviews.author: the amish wonder

customer_reviews.title: This chair will become trash within 4 months
customer_reviews.text: The chair looks nice, is extremely easy to assemble and feels pretty decent for the first 35 days. After that, all bets are off. I bought this thing less than 120 days ago. It has already become a creaky, wobbly, uncomfortable piece of garbage. The padding is already basically useless, I can feel the lumbar support digging into my back. Conversely, the Steelcase chair I've used at my job for the last decade is still going strong. Don't be suckered into the low price of this chair like I was; it'll cost you more when you need to buy a decent chair to replace this lackluster chair in a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Tesser

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I research everything. I spent alot of time and chose this chair. Assembly was easy, color and texture were great. The issue is comfort. This chair is not comfortable. You are forced to sit very upright and it does not lean back, only rocks back minimally. Felt like being pushed forward when sitting in it. The bottom seat cushion is good but that's about it. If you want to sit upright at all times, go for it. If you like to relax and lean back a bit, this is not your chair.
customer_reviews.author: Mermaiddurr

customer_reviews.title: Good chair, looks great, some hard time putting it together
customer_reviews.text: The chair, once put together is good. But not all the screws go all the way into the predrilled holes/threading. It took me a whole night to get the last 4 screws in (the back support piece) and I am not confident it is all done perfectly. It is comfortable to sit in and truth be told I fell asleep in it. But you need the strength of a bull to squeeze those pieces together to line up the holes.
customer_reviews.author: Amy-Riva

customer_reviews.title: 1 year and falling apart
customer_reviews.text: Granted, COVID has hit so I'm in this chair 14 hours a day sometimes, but..... The plastic covers for the bolts come off, and after 1 year, the back "popped" loudly and sent backwards a bit. I've tighted the bolts.... again, but the back is now visibly loose. Not happy with this chair. The "leather" is starting to peel off, but probably because I'm rubbing it up against the file cabinet. The wheels are horrible so I replaced them with the roller-caster kits with roller blade wheels... MUCH better... almost TOO good... but... the chair is still not that great... comfy, but already showing it's age.
customer_reviews.author: Crusty

customer_reviews.title: Nice basic computer/desk chair, not very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Well it was not that hard to assemble, One issue about installing bolt cover caps. The holes in the right arm were right on, The holes in the left arm have extra plastic sticking up around the edges, so the cover caps will not fit flush, I had to carefully file away until flat for caps to go in flush. One other issue is turn knob for tilt tension, Instruction booklet says turn counter clockwise to tighten tension,WRONG! Turn clockwise to tighten tension, Turn counter clockwise to lesson tension. And there is no contact information for getting hardware parts. Also seat height does not go lower as other brands, 20" to floor
customer_reviews.author: D. Fahey

customer_reviews.title: Great chair at first
customer_reviews.text: First, this chair looks and feels great. I've used it consistently since Covid lead to consistent working from my home office. However, despite very sparing use from December to March and typical office use from March to July, the area where the back meets the arms has come loose from the inside of the back of the chair, causing it to lose most of its back stability. It seems poorly constructed internally and there's really no fix unless I tear off the upholstery to get into the inner workings of the back of the chair. It's disappointing because I really like it, otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: 2.25 years old and broken
customer_reviews.text: This chair was never really all that comfortable, the back support was lacking to the point where I had a pillow behind me. Then, today, 2 years and 3 months after I bought it, it broke. Whatever the bolts go into that hold on the arm rests has broken in the base, and the arm rests hold on the back. Back to my 15 year old cloth chair for now, and time to go shopping for something better.
customer_reviews.author: Corey O

customer_reviews.title: 6 month review, big guy! Buy it!!
customer_reviews.text: This chair is amazing. Holds up really well! I'm 6 1" and 250 plus. Depends on the day. I plop down on this thing, always have my arms on the rests, not very nice for the most part. It has held up. Nothing has broken, ripped, fallen off, etc. I've used and abused many office chairs. This by far is the best one at this or any price point I've had. Hopefully it will be the same quality if I need another. Buy one!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Oregon

customer_reviews.title: Unless they are making these cheaper, mine has lasted 4 years.
customer_reviews.text: I bought my chair in mid 2016, and it has been a great chair. It is just now beginning to show minor tears in some of the seems. It has been used it nearly daily (as in nearly 7 days a week) for two and a half years now. I made sure when assembling it not to over tighten the bolts like probably many of the people giving poor reviews have. I have only had to tighten the bolts once in the past 4 years. People reporting tears or breaks as soon as it was assembled probably over tightened the bolts. DO NOT TIGHTEN AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE INTO WOODEN FRAMES That should go without saying...
customer_reviews.author: Timothy J. Salotto

customer_reviews.title: 9 months in and...
customer_reviews.text: I like the price, ease of assembly color and design, and initial comfort. I dislike the quality of the product. I received it with damage to the metal supports that holds the arm wrests. After 9 months the bottom cushion is already showing signs of wear in support, not on the surface. Its a great chair for the sale price, at actual price I would advice to go with a better brand with more quality and history. I will be looking to upgrade shortly if anyone has recommendations.
customer_reviews.author: alan patke

customer_reviews.title: Before you buy this chair please read it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chair right after I started working from home due to Covid. When I first got this chair I really liked it. But over the time I developed lower back pain. The chair is way to big and it leaves a huge gap between Your back and back rest. There is no support for your back. You can’t lean back into the backrest if you need to type. Well long story sort, ended up going to a chiropractor twice a week now. Thank to Amazon for selling such a bs quality chair.
customer_reviews.author: Diya

customer_reviews.title: Nice chair
customer_reviews.text: This chair did server me well; lasted almost 4 years, need to replace it. Starting to fall apart, leather (or leather like material) is getting worn out on the heavy use area. Last 6+ months has been getting heavy used - 10+ hrs every day, before that about 2/3 days a week where I was using it all day, other days hour here and there. It's been good, actually thinking about buying same one again - since it serve me good, pretty comfortable. One negative thing - does not breath very well - sometime gets hot, depending what clothes I'm wearing. Over all pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Opyd

customer_reviews.title: Broke before the one year mark
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was lucky because I got this as a "Deal of the Day" and saved some money. It worked ok for a while until after 11 months of daily use a spring in the center of the chair where your butt sits broke. It didn't go through the material but pushed up and wouldn't go back down making it very difficult to sit on with comfort. When I replace this chair I'm going to go with a different company.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: I'm in love
customer_reviews.text: I've been waiting so I could really try it out I work from home making things like shirts decals pillow cases and way more so I'm in the chair alot the support isnt perfect witch is what I need for my back but isnt that big of a deal for me cause I can buy a peace to help with that cause I move alot and dont sit straight but it is however super super comfortable it's the right size it looks amazing in my Livingroom of course I have to pain my desk my Livingroom is in black red and white but d ask is brown other then that it's really 100% perfect
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Great looking chair...comfortable...but cannot lock in tilt position.
customer_reviews.text: Chair was easy to assemble and it looks amazing. For that, A++. Chair is pretty comfortable, however, I expected it to have a tilt that could be locked into place. It does tilt when 1) in unlocked position and 2) tension knob is turned in clockwise position as you are sitting in the chair. BUT air will not lock in tilted position. I have back issues and need a slight tilt, so that is disappointing. It’s too difficult to return such a large item, so I am keeping it. I would like to see more clarification on that in the description for future buyers.
customer_reviews.author: Carie C

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I purchased this chair. Due to our state stay at home order, my husband and I are both working from home. We have an office that we usually take turns using but with both of us being on calls all day, we had to figure something else out. I made a makeshift office in a spare bedroom and bought this chair as it looked comfortable. It sure is! It’s very comfortable and leans back without feeling like you’re going to fall out. It took me maybe 20 minutes to build the chair which is not what I expected. It was so easy. Definitely love this chair!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice chair if you follow the simple instructions
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this chair for only a couple days and so far it seems well made and comfortable. We'll see how it goes in the long run. Assembly was easy and the instructions were clear. One thing to keep in mind; the arms are marked Left and Right. This means Left and Right while sitting in the chair. Yep, I was looking at the partially assembled chair from the front and got the arms reversed. Easily corrected. Stupid me. Maybe the two glasses of wine I'd had Christmas Eve before the assembly had something to do with it.
customer_reviews.author: The Fred

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a good chair.
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was a snap with unboxing to sitting requiring less than a half-hour unassisted with no additional tools. For my frame (6'4"/250+), the seat pan could have been a few inches longer to provide better support. This is not a big chair. Experience has shown these type of chairs tend to only last a few years until the cushioning, fabric, and lift are gone. Could be wrong in this instance, but price has always been my determinate and this chair scores well in that area. Reviews of any chair within a month or so of delivery should probably be taken with a grain of salt.
customer_reviews.author: MGW

customer_reviews.title: Great chair at a great price, would buy again
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased a few work desk chairs in the past, but usually from the office stores only after looking at the quality of the chair materials, so I was hesitant to buy online without seeing it first. But after receiving my chair today, I am very happy I took the chance on it. It is great quality chair, the leather whether faux or not feels really good. Assembled easily and quickly (about 15 mins). I would buy this again
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, beautiful, firm. We purchased the plastic thing to protect our wooden floor as well, and put a rug under that. It moves easily but doesn't just slide around of its own will. The material looks like real leather (which I only assume it isn't) and is quite comfortable. I don't sweat on it, and it has some cushion. The arm rests are well positioned and the height adjustments are smooth. It bends back some, but you have to put weight into it though I don't find that to be an issue. Looks great next to my desk.
customer_reviews.author: amvs

customer_reviews.title: Missing half a castor
customer_reviews.text: I hate to write a bad review for this nice chair. I received it today and it is really nice. Went together fairly simply. Seems to have good support. Bigger than I had expected. The reason for the one star: it is missing half of a castor wheel. When I contacted customer service they informed me that no single parts can be shipped. It is basically either send it back for a refund/exchange or keep it with one missing part. Sadly, I need the chair for working so sending it back is not an option. Its made by AmazonBasics, so you would getting a replacement part from them would be easier than another seller. Apparently not.
customer_reviews.author: jenjen

customer_reviews.title: Would be a great chair if it would STAY PUT
customer_reviews.text: This chair is comfortable, but it is NOT stable. Every single time I sit in it, I have to get up every few minutes and pull the seat back up higher, even though I've locked it. It SUCKS and is very aggravating. It's been this way from day one, but lately it's gotten worse and instead of having to adjust every 10-15 minutes it's literally every 2-4 minutes. I'm sick of it and wish I could return it, I should have listened to my gut and done so right away. EDIT - Dropped to one star. It's getting worse every day. I hate this chair. I'm getting a new one from ANYWHERE else.
customer_reviews.author: KristiB1234

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, but had scratches on metal
customer_reviews.text: I really like how comfortable the chair is, but during assembly I noticed a lot of scratch marks on the metal areas of the armrest. Granted, I let Amazon know, and they are graciously sending another chair to me in hopes that those parts are better, and if so, I'll bump this to a 4 or 5 star. The metal does appear to be very easy to scratch, so definitely be careful during assembly. If you are able to get one without scratches, I really think you'll enjoy sitting in this chair. It's great to look at and very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Annemarie Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: It's a GREAT VALUE for $120! I don't know what the 1 star reviews are complaining about. It's beautiful, looks great, is comfortable. I love it. I saw some people complaining that its not real leather. Of course it's NOT... IT'S $120!! DON'T listen to the bad reviews. It's an excellent purchase and great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia B.

customer_reviews.title: Been using for about 3 years. Sufficient for gaming sessions
customer_reviews.text: This is a great chair. Excellent value for the price. I'm 6'2 and about 280 pounds. Never had an issue with this. I have back issues from a very bad accident. But this doesnt bother my back that much. Pretty easy to assemble too. Instructions were straightforward as well. Sure there are those highly expensive racing style chairs. But I don't feel the need to get one at this point. This chair is sufficient for gaming sessions. The material has held up incredibly well. No rips or punctures. Overall an excellent value in this price range. Does not feel cheap one bit. I would suggest trying this out. Amazon basics has outdone themselves with this chair 110 percent.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Easily assembled with one minor weakness for me
customer_reviews.text: I just received and assembled the chair yesterday. This appears to be a sturdy chair and reasonable value for the cost. The hydraulic up and down works well and the chair back can be locked if you don't want to lean back (my preference). My one star loss is due to when you sit, your bottom seems to want to slide forward a little. Its really a minor thing and I will get used to it. All and all I am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: T. H. Sutphen

customer_reviews.title: Love This Chair!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a sleek, modern looking white chair to complement my L-shaped desk in a light ash wood color. This chair fit the bill perfectly. I've had it now for a few weeks and it is so comfortable for all-day work from home and looks excellent with the desk I have. I highly recommend this chair for the excellent price! Looks more expensive than it is.
customer_reviews.author: Burned notice

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, "leather" peels off all over the floor
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a temporary replacement until I could find a high end chair, and never got around to doing so. After a year, it looks awful. The "leather" is peeling off and I find pieces of it all over the floor. Structurally it's sound, but it looks like I fished it out of the dumpster. Which is where I intend to leave it soon.
customer_reviews.author: Tobar Dobinson

customer_reviews.title: The chair headed to the dump after 1 year
customer_reviews.text: I was happy with this chair in the beginning. Comfy, supportive and a good price. The pleather started to peel after 1 year and it literally could not give it away. It ended up in the dump. I ended up paying more to get a chair that will last. Inexpensive, but cheap, and in the long run, I ended up spending more.
customer_reviews.author: L. Lapio

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend what a great chair!!
customer_reviews.text: What a great chair! Better than the chairs in stores that go for hundreds dollars. This chair looks like it was really expensive with out the price tag. I bought this chair as a gift for my dad years ago for Christmas and it’s still holding up amazingly and I’d say it still looks brand new! It was very easy to assemble. It’s SO comfortable and gives great support. I’d recommend this chair 1000%
customer_reviews.author: Gianna

customer_reviews.title: Great over all build quality. I think there is no doubt about it. However ...
customer_reviews.text: Great over all build quality. I think there is no doubt about it. However, I think the ergonomics are not of top standards. The place where thigh rests is higher than where your butt rests. Hence, you tend to bend further to reach the keyboard if you are of average height... 5'5" - 5'9" ish. This puts enormous amount of stress on the back and prompts for a bad posture. If you do not spend much time on the chair, I would say go for it. If you work from home most of the time or spend more time than normal, I would recommend looking for a better chair.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Cheap junk.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chair about a year ago. I use it half-time--I have a standing desk, that can be cranked down. the back support is awful because the there is a dead-bolt like mechanism that keeps it from tilting back--but the bolt is too small so it wiggles. One year out--the back of the chair is separating from where it is bolted into the armrests. so the thing is basically junk. I regret the purchase--don't buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Sam F.

customer_reviews.title: TILT
customer_reviews.text: only had a week but so far so good EXCEPT directions said turn tension knob clockwise for easier tilt back...should say counter clockwise to loosen tension spring to have easier tilt back...it isn't the tilt I had in my other chair and only reason I do 4 stars.My other chair when I leaned back it stayed in that position...this have to kind of hold it back...was easy to put together....rolls nice on my mat...Like I said only one week but so far I like it....if you are particular do your measurements...
customer_reviews.author: T. R. Draper

customer_reviews.title: A disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Chair was difficult to assemble, one screw refused to screw in all the way and I couldn't put the cap on without trimming it. Today I noticed, after just a month of daily use, that the dye in the leather is already wearing off in spots. It's fading terribly where my back and head contact the chair as I'm sitting. I'm going to contact Amazon for some sort of adjustment as it's beyond the return window. Unfortunately I threw out the packaging along with the old chair that this one was supposed to replace, so I couldn't return it anyhow.
customer_reviews.author: iDRMRSR

customer_reviews.title: arrived on time and appears to be well constructed.
customer_reviews.text: Chair for the most is comfortable and well padded. I was a little disappointed with the height of the back. It is only slightly higher than a mid height chair, the top of the back is even with my shoulders and I'm only 5'7" so I'm unable to rest my head back like I am used to, other than that I am pleased with it so far, but time will tell how it holds up
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to build
customer_reviews.text: Note that this chair does NOT recline, which is a downside for me, but if that's not an issue for you, then this is a great chair. I've only had it for two days, but it's really comfortable and was extremely easy to put together. The last chair I bought was awkward to put together due to the placement of screws. This chair, on the other hand, being my second chair that I've built, only took 20 minutes with no issues. Instructions were clear and there were no complications or awkwardness while building. No complaints except for the lack of recline.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Yaworski

customer_reviews.title: Started good, then the material started sloughing off
customer_reviews.text: This chair does not get a ton of use, however, both armrests, and both seat/edge areas started to have the cover peel off slowly, and now to the point where i had to put black duct tape on it just so my wife, myself and out 17th month old isn't walking around with random black spots of material stuck to random areas on us. Value initially, but I guess you get what you pay for. Spend a little more, enjoy it A LOT LONGER. Would not recommend this chair unless you need it only for a year or less.
customer_reviews.author: Jail murse 808

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable & Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: I needed an office chair for a while. This one looked lush, comfortable, and matched my desk and home office very well. I got it yesterday, built it in about 30 minutes (not the first chair I have assembled), and immediately began enjoying it. I like that it rolls so I can move around a little bit. I have an active online job and need to be able to move about my desk freely. This chair is definitely comfortable for working all day at my desk. I love how when I type I feel very comfortable. This chair will certainly make the time I spend in my office at my desk a little easier,.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Feltner

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for an office chair, nice color, comfortable, have had another chair for occasional use for 3 years, no problems. Thirty minutes to assemble, all parts there, decent quality. Not sure why all the negative reviews, it works well for me..shipped in 7 days, reclines well, arm supports fine, people need to assemble the chair properly and tighten the bolts in order for it to hold up. No leather wear after 3 years. Like anything, you have to take care, maintain your furniture for it to last.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful comfortable and perfect for home office
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful chair great for home office. Able to rise or lower as needed. Swings back with unlock option however doesn’t lock when leaning back. Only on the straight sitting option. Not a deal breaker for me but good to know if u like to lean back for long periods of time or in a set position. Overall very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Yvi

customer_reviews.title: Awesome chair
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. We have had this for over a year now and still in great shape! It is like new. This is impressive because.. 1. We have 3 children to like to pretend this chair is a carnival ride 2. My husband and I are not what you would concider small people. And by not small people I mean we are the kind of people you might hesitate letting on a crowded elevator 3. Our middle child likes to think he is invincible and used this chair as an accessory to what I am positive was a tempting death experience. The chair held up a better than he did.
customer_reviews.author: Audet

customer_reviews.title: Feels cheap
customer_reviews.text: This chair feels cheap. The material feels cheap, definitely not leather. The base arm rest is plastic. There’s chips and scuffs of the the spray paint. The seat looks plush but it still pretty firm. A little too bulky for my liking. The chair also runs hot. After sitting for an hour it becomes hot and my back will start to sweat. Not much ventilation. I say search for a better chair before you settle with this one. I do like the color though. The white is very clean looking for now.
customer_reviews.author: Vetyaz

customer_reviews.title: Last 3 years only
customer_reviews.text: This is a comfortable chair. And we bought quite a few. The structure is fine. However, the problem is that it does not last long. One would expect a desk chair to last 10-15 years. This one lasts 3 years, and it starts to deteriorates. The surface starts to peel off. It is better to buy a chair twice as expensive that would last 5x longer. Amazon would need to elevate the quality of its own brand product, or they risk damaging the reputation of the AmazonBasics brand. There is some way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Baymate

customer_reviews.title: Screw mounts tore out of the particle board back.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't even make it 2 years. The metal mounts embedded into the particle board that makes up the back of the chair pulled tore clean out of the board while leaning back in the chair. There's no repair that can be done, the back is just floating on one side now. The fake leather on the arm rests was separating anyway so it looks pretty trashy but I always hope to get at least 2 years out of this cheap disposable Chinese crap.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin B

customer_reviews.title: Nice, cost effective computer chair.
customer_reviews.text: Needed a new office chair during the pandemic and Amazon had this one in stock. Chair assembled easy enough, the faux leather is nice looking and has held up well so far. The chair arms are plastic and seem durable enough. I'm 250lbs and it holds me just fine. The only gripe I have the seat cushion. After long periods of sitting it does tend to make your rear end a little sore but I just use that as a reminder to get up and stretch every so often. Very cost effective chair and pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Almost 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this chair a 5 Star review except that we had to return it within days of purchase because the lift mechanism would constantly settle to the lowest setting after a few hours of not sitting down. Amazon was excellent at making the return easy, and the replacement chair has operated very well.
customer_reviews.author: sb

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed. Since this is an AmazonBasics item, Amazon should replace or refund for poor design.
customer_reviews.text: Similar to Chris Alexander, mine lasted just over 1 year before the poorly designed brackets for the arms and back broke through the plywood seat bottom. The bracket should have been placed under the plywood for more distributed strength. Instead, the captured nuts just ripped up through the plywood. His pictures are exactly like what happened to mine. Edit: How many people is this happening to? Faulty designs should be refunded and Amazon should stand behind this.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Black

customer_reviews.title: Great Chair - Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Nice chair. I bought this chair for my husband’s desk and bought the mid-back for myself. I should have gotten 2 of these!!! This seat is very comfortable and I would highly recommend it. As far as assembling it, the parts were there and marked well. It was easy to assemble but the instructions have you put the casters on first. I would save this step for last. I had to have help holding the seat while attaching the back as the chair kept trying to roll away! It was just a minor inconvenience. I would recommend the chair to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Angela M.

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Quality
customer_reviews.text: The chair looked nice upon arrival and it was easy enough to put together but the chair started falling apart soon after. The cheap plastic that covers the whole chair began peeling away little by little. The caps that cover the screws have all popped off. It is just a mess and I just purchased it last year. Now I'm going to have to buy a new chair since this one has become so unsightly. Smh....waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: The Mrs.

customer_reviews.title: I found the perfect chair!
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t even know that office chairs come in white but when I saw this one I had to get it! It matches my desk perfectly and was so easy to put together. Was a little unsure being Amazon basics brand, but it was such a good deal and looked so nice so I had to give it a try. I have to say, I am not disappointed! It’s very comfortable, rolls and turns smooth, and hasn’t even gotten discolored which is what I was most unsure about. Overall, great deal, great quality, and I really enjoy it!
customer_reviews.author: BrutallyHonestReviews

customer_reviews.title: Looks good Day 1.
customer_reviews.text: 18 MONTHS UPDATE: Still Works Perfectly. Day one appears to be solid construction. Easy to assemble, took 20 minutes. Chair looks good. The real question is how long will it last. I've had chairs from Staples that lasted barely 12 months before a critical failure that wasn't covered by a warranty. UPDATE: I'm even more impressed after using it for a couple of weeks. If it lasts for three years, it's a no brainer.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Miller

customer_reviews.title: These chairs are great...this is our third one!
customer_reviews.text: This is the third time we have ordered this chair. As our son begins college we want him to have a comfortable place to work. My husband and I both have this chair and purchased one more for our son's new work area. The chair is reasonably priced, comfortable and has held up over time!
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Haar

customer_reviews.title: probably not for me
customer_reviews.text: it's easy to assemble alright. But beware, if you don't like it and want to return, you'll have a tough time disassemble it because it's super hard to take the air lift off (search tutorial how on youtube). I wanted to like it but I couldn't. The chair is a bit long so if you want to touch your back to its support, you'll have your whole thighs on the chair which is kinda uncomfortable. It is also a bit inclined to the back so it's not helping my back very much.
customer_reviews.author: Yooo

customer_reviews.title: going on two years
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chair back in April 2017 and it has been the best office chair I've had. moving twice since then and being completely abused by my cats. the fabric has held up well considering for a brief while I had a cat that was consistently clawing at it like a scratching post. For ~$100 it's better than the chairs my office supplies to myself and my coworkers. I'm looking forward to purchasing another one shortly to replace the current one, and potentially my office chair as well. 2 years is an acceptable life for such an inexpensive chair.
customer_reviews.author: KillerZip

customer_reviews.title: Nice chair, parts replacement fail.
customer_reviews.text: A great solid chair for the money, but one of the plastic plugs that snap in and cover the bolt holes was damaged and I'm told that my only recourse (rather than sending me a replacement plug or accessory kit - the plug is probably $.02) is to return/replace the whole chair. It's not worth the time and hassle for a $.02 item (and think how much money Amazon is wasting in shipping costs to swap the whole chair for a $.02 item), but certainly takes away from the finished look of the chair. Something to keep in mind when considering future Amazon Basics purchases - simple replacement parts are apparently not an option.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S. Cassill

customer_reviews.title: It's a genuine office chair!
customer_reviews.text: Recommend first step in instructions should be ignored if assembling solo: install base wheels. That can more easily be done AFTER the chair is fully assembled by merely turning it upside down. The wheels insert easily. Should you have help, do as you see fit. Assembly is simple (with help) but don't let that disway you from purchasing. Impressed with the locking preservative added to the main bolts (the blue stuff). Highly functional, well packaged and, while not leather, VERY comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Eric S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Chair
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. Affordable price. Easy to assemble. Did it in 20-30 minutes for a newbie like me. Wonderful packaging and instructions. Firm, comfortable seat. Looks awesome. Great color selection. FYI: The caps that cover the hand rail screws fall off, but does not hinder structure or use. More a cosmetic issue. I don’t really mind. BUT: If you have children or pets, I wouldn’t use them so as not to be a choking hazard. Material does not leave oily fingerprints. Material is easy to clean off pen marks with rubbing alcohol and general cleaners. Materials are strong and sturdy for all sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 5.5 months
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this chair because I needed a basic, professional looking office chair. I was in a hurry to get an office up and running and the last item needed was the chair. I have used the chair almost every day now for just over five months. Sometimes as little as a few minutes per day, and other times for over eight (8) hours nonstop. I like the chair. The cushion is good. The pivot is good. Even the weight is good. Overall I was not expecting much for the ~$109 I paid for it. I am definitely satisfied with my purchase and I do not regret it. I would recommend it for a medium use, daily office chair.
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: It will last a couple years.
customer_reviews.text: I use the chair daily in my office. It sits well. There are only a couple things that annoy me. One the little plastic pieces that cover the screw holes are always falling off. The other thing is that about a month ago the chair just height adjustment lever just stopped working. I have to lift my chair probable 5 times a day and now I will replace it. I was hoping is would have lasted a little longer. I would not purchase this chair again.
customer_reviews.author: Chb548s

product_meta.title: AmazonBasics High-Back, Leather Executive, Swivel, Adjustable Office Desk Chair with Casters, Brown
feature_bullets: Comfortable executive chair upholstered in bonded Brown Leather and Pewter finish frame
Padded seat and back for all-day comfort and support
Pneumatic seat-height adjustment; 360-degree swivel; smooth-rolling casters
Chair Dimensions: 29.13 x 25.59 x 41.34-45.08 inches (LxWxH); assembly instructions included

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars10,709 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
